details.title: Reliability Sampling Plans Under Progressive Type-I Interval Censoring Using Cost Functions

kwd: progressively type-I interval censored life tests

authors.affiliation: Dept. of Stat., Tamkang Univ., Taipei

p: Syuan-Rong Huang is currently a Ph.D. student in the Graduate Institute of Management Sciences at Tamkang University, Taiwan. He received his Master degree in Statistic from Tamkang University in 2007. His research interest is industrial statistics.

authors.name: Syuan-Rong Huang

p: Shuo-Jye Wu is a Professor in the Department of Statistics at Tamkang University, in Taiwan. He received his Ph.D. in Statistics from the University of Wisconsin-Madison in 1996. He is a member of American Statistical Association (ASA), and International Chinese Statistical Association (ICSA). His research interests are in the development and application of statistical methodology for problems in reliability.

details.abstract: This paper gives a reliability sampling plan for progressively type I interval censored life tests when the lifetime follows the exponential distribution. We use the maximum likelihood method to obtain the point estimation of the parameter of failure time distribution. We provide an approach to establish reliability sampling plans which minimize the total cost of life testing under given consumer's and producer's risks. Some numerical studies are investigated to illustrate the proposed approach.

references.title:
Progressive interval censoring: Some mathematical
results with applications to inference

context.text: Some important literature can be found, for example, Aggarwala [1], Xiang & Tse [23], Wu et al. [22], and Yang & Tse [24].

references.text: R. Aggarwala, "Progressive interval censoring: Some mathematical results with applications to inference", Communications in StatisticsTheory & Methods, vol. 30, pp. 1921-1935, 2001.

references.title:
Statistical inference for the Burr model
based on progressively censored data

context.text: In this topic, much statistical inference work has been done by several authors including, for example, Ali Mousa & Jaheen [2], Gouno et al. [10], Guilbaud [11], and Li et al. [13], Lin et al. [14], Soliman [17], [18], Tse & Yuen [21].

references.text: M. A. M. Ali Mousa, Z. F. Jaheen, "Statistical inference for the Burr model based on progressively censored data", Computers & Mathematics With Applications, vol. 43, pp. 1441-1449, 2002.

references.title:
Progressive censoring methodology: An appraisal

context.text: A recent account on progressive censoring can be found in the monograph by Balakrishnan & Aggarwala [4], or in the review article by Balakrishnan [3].

references.text: N. Balakrishnan, "Progressive censoring methodology: An appraisal (with discussions)", Test, vol. 16, pp. 211-296, 2007.

references.title: Progressive CensoringTheory, Methods, and Applications

context.text: A recent account on progressive censoring can be found in the monograph by Balakrishnan & Aggarwala [4], or in the review article by Balakrishnan [3].

references.title:
Point and interval estimation for Gaussian
distribution, based on progressively type-II censored samples

links.abstract: The likelihood equations based on a progressively Type-II censored sample from a Gaussian distribution do not provide explicit solutions in any situation except the complete sample case. This paper examines numerically the bias and mean square error of the MLE, and demonstrates that the probability coverages of the pivotal quantities (for location and scale parameters) based on asymptotic s-normality are unsatisfactory, and particularly so when the effective sample size is small. Therefore, this...

references.text: N. Balakrishnan, N. Kannan, C.-T. Lin, H. K. T. Ng, "Point and interval estimation for Gaussian distribution based on progressively type-II censored samples", IEEE Trans. Reliability, vol. 52, pp. 90-95, 2003.

Reliability sampling plans for the two-parameter

context.text: In the literature, Balasooryia & Saw [6], and Tse & Yang [19] derived reliability sampling plans for exponential, and Weibull distributions, respectively, based on progressively type-II censored data.

references.text: U. Balasooryia, S. L. C. Saw, "Reliability sampling plans for the two-parameter exponential distribution under progressive censoring", Journal of Applied Statistics, vol. 25, pp. 707-714, 1998.

references.title:
Optimal
step-stress test under progressive type-I censoring

context.text: [10], Guilbaud [11], and Li et al. [13], Lin et al. [14], Soliman [17], [18], Tse & Yuen [21].

links.abstract: We consider in this work a k-step-stress accelerated test with equal duration steps /spl tau/. Censoring is allowed at each change stress point i/spl tau/, i=1,...k. The problem of choosing the optimal /spl tau/ is addressed using variance optimality as well as determinant-optimality criteria. We investigate in detail the case of progressively Type-I right censored data with a single stress variable.

references.text: E. Gouno, A. Sen, N. Balakrishnan, "Optimal step-stress test under progressive type-I censoring", IEEE Trans. Reliability, vol. 53, pp. 388-393, 2004.

references.title:
Reliability sampling methodology using simulation
and re-sampling

context.text: Some other related papers are, for example, Chen et al. [7], Chung et al. [8], Fernández [9], and Nierwinski [16].

links.abstract: This paper develops and validates a reliability sampling methodology using simulation, and re-sampling; and which incorporates unit-to-unit variation in the determination of significant sample sizes for analytically intractable reliability cases. This sample size determination is very important because the reliability of the sampled vehicles should represent the reliability of the entire fleet. Smaller-than-required sample sizes may lead to an incorrect representation of the reliability of the f...

references.text: J. Nierwinski, "Reliability sampling methodology using simulation and re-sampling", IEEE Trans. Reliability, vol. 56, pp. 125-131, 2007.

references.title:
Estimation of parameters of life from progressively
censored data using Burr-XII model

context.text: In this topic, much statistical inference work has been done by several authors including, for example, Ali Mousa & Jaheen [2], Gouno et al. [10], Guilbaud [11], and Li et al. [13], Lin et al. [14], Soliman [17], [18], Tse & Yuen [21].

links.abstract: Based on progressively Type-II censored samples, the maximum likelihood, and Bayes estimators for some lifetime parameters (reliability, and hazard functions), as well as the parameters of the Burr-XII model, are derived. The Bayes estimators are obtained using both the symmetric (Squared Error, SE) loss function, and asymmetric (LINEX, and General Entropy, GE) loss functions. This was done with respect to the conjugate prior for the one shape parameter, and discrete prior for the other paramete...

references.text: A. A. Soliman, "Estimation of parameters of life from progressively censored data using Burr-XII model", IEEE Trans. Reliability, vol. 54, pp. 34-42, 2005.
